Pre-Game Insights: The Kansas City Royals and the Atlanta Braves meet Sunday in MLB action from Truist Park.
This will be the final installment in a three-game series.
Alec Marsh will start for KC on Sunday. Marsh is 8-9 with a 4.65 ERA in 25 games (24 starts) this year.
Atlanta will send out Charlie Morton on Sunday as starter. Morton is 8-9 with a 4.08 ERA in 29 games so far.
Fourteen of the Braves' last 15 home games against AL Central opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Six of the Royals' last seven road games have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Braves' last five home games.
Ozzie Albies has recorded at least one Single in each of the Braves' last four day games against AL opponents that held a winning record.
Matt Olson has hit at least one home run in three of the Braves' last four day games against opponents that held a winning record.
Matt Olson has recorded at least one RBI in seven of the Braves' last eight day games.
Jarred Kelenic has recorded at least one total base in each of his last 16 appearances against AL opponents at Truist Park.
Ronald Acuna Jr. has scored at least one run in six of his last seven appearances against AL Central opponents that held a winning record.
Jarred Kelenic has recorded at least one hit in each of his last 12 home appearances against AL Central opponents.
Bobby Witt Jr. has recorded at least one Single in eight of his last nine road appearances against NL opponents that held a winning record.
Bobby Witt Jr. has hit a home run in five of the Royals' last seven day games against opponents that held a winning record.
Vinnie Pasquantino has recorded at least one RBI in six of his last seven road appearances against NL opponents.
Vinnie Pasquantino has recorded at least one total base in each of his last nine appearances against NL East opponents.
Michael Lorenzen has scored a run in each of his last three appearances.
Vinnie Pasquantino has recorded a Double in three of his last four appearances against NL East opponents that held a winning record.
Vinnie Pasquantino has recorded at least one hit in each of his last nine appearances against NL East opponents.
